embeds.title: Ultimate Stance
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 (0) :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

During your next turn, you are in **Ultimate** **Stance**.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Isn't it kinda fucked up that it's named the same as the stance.
it is
When people want to talk about ultimate stance you gotta specify if you mean the stance or the card.
~~that said the beta art is great~~
this card is okay
ultimate stance just isn't as interesting as divinity
it's just two stances stapled together
and the main part of what makes the stance good, the multiple activations of <technical jig> and the repeated finishers, is not renewable

embeds.title: Technical Jig
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Whenever you enter a **Stance**, gain 3 (4) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: like yeah, being able to play multple finishers in a single turn is good, but no one drafts that many finishers that they need ultimate stance to play them
and if they do they're going to die
moment of truth+ and rope a dopes?
ultimate stance needs a renewable way to enter it like a <worship>

embeds.title: Worship
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :purple_energy: / The Watcher / Slay the Spire

 (**Retain**.)
Gain 5 Mantra :p_mantra:.

messages.content: and a more interesting payoff
you are not drafting 5 rope a dopes and then drawing them all at the same time
you're drafting a couple and then headbutting them
thick deck champ is not good
I tend to have quite a few finisher cards in my deck, but ultimate stance rarely does anything for me
It seems good in theory, but it doesn't really help in practice
I can't agree - I find that "take every Ultimate Stance, Gut Punch, and Moment of Truth" is a strong component of many of my winning champ decks
Just taking lots of cheap finishers and Stance Dances is already good
not going to last long enough to win act 4 in my opinion
The heavy ultimate deck still crushes the act 4 elites easily but can run out of steam on Neow if you don't have a second plan to transition into (eg those Stance Dances)
Yeah gonna use this as a general discussion on ultimate stance (the stance) rather than this card, as it is a bog-standard way of entering it.
I think it's a bit of a trap since it wants you to have a lot more finishers than you would normally want, but the issue is that with not great luck or a long fight you can burn out quick.
“may i have <type=relic lose 15 block> please”

embeds.title: Calipers
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of your turn, lose 15 **Block** :p_block: rather than all of your **Block** :p_block:.
*"Mechanical precision leads to greatness" - The Architect*

messages.content: well that or glad forms
ult stance can be a great way to pile up a lot of vigor/counter/block if you have persistency tools for it
champ also has <hold firm> which can suffice if your deck is thin enough

embeds.title: Hold Firm
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 2 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Gain 10 (13) **Block** :p_block:.
Gain 10 (13) **Counter** :p_counter:.
Gain 1 **Blur** :p_blur:.

messages.content: There's uh, that card that gives you energy or draw based on your stance, and then you can get both with ultimate stance. That part is pretty cool, and if you have a critical mass of ultimate stance maybe you can take a bunch of finishers. Still, that's like the only thing all that notable
<refreshment>

embeds.title: Refreshment
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

*Berserker **Combo:** Gain :energy_champ: :energy_champ:  ( :energy_champ:) , then **Exhaust** this.
Defensive **Combo:** Draw 3 (4) cards.

messages.content: ill find it someday
Yeah this one
<waiter waiter more calipers please>

I Do agree that changing the name of this card would help to clarify the difference between the stance and itself, maybe something like ultimate preparations? Functionally, this card is very weird, and doesn't mesh well with champs strengths and weaknesses in my opinion. Setting yourself to have a very powerful next turn to try and burst the enemy out doesn't make a whole lot of sense when champ's natural vigor burst tends to be strong enough to end most short and medium length fights without needing to wait another turn. In those spots, this card just slows you down most of the time. On the other hand, for very long boss fights (especially neow) the power provided by the one turn of ultimate during your next turn is nowhere near enough to actually close the fight out, and since this exhausts, it's not a sustainable form of damage. In some medium length fights, you can use this to prepare for one massive turn to try and close things out faster, but I think those spots are few and far between.

Gut punch makes this card look atrocious. It's uncommon, deals good frontloaded damage, has you enter the stance immediately, and is much easier to use to close out medium length fights. Sure, as an attack it will consume your vigor which could be saved for a multihit, but unless you can reliably land rope a dope on the same turn as ultimate stance, I think gut punch will be better nearly every time. Without that or runic pyramid, it can be difficult to reliably use this effect. You would like to play a bunch of finishers and skills to enter stances, proc finisher bonuses, get both combos and stack vigor/counter, but it's fairly difficult to put that many finishers in your deck and still be functional on the turns where you don't have access to ultimate stance. I just have a very hard time justifying taking this over other rares for champ, or paying for it at a store. Upgrade is good, helps to ease the impact of the off turn while you wait. Cute with strange spoon.

* finishers
